Shortcut featsel_loss_function_permutations

featsel_loss_function_permutations.Rd

Shortcut featsel_loss_function_permutations

featsel_loss_function_permutations(
  model,
  stat = c("median", "mean", "min", "q25", "q75", "max"),
  B = 10,
  n_sample = NULL,
  loss_function = DALEX::loss_one_minus_auc,
  verbose = TRUE,
  plot = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

model

model
stat

= c("median", "mean", "min", "q25", "q75", "max"),
B

Iterations, defaults to 10 for each variable
n_sample

n_sample
loss_function

Default to DALEX::loss_one_minus_auc
verbose

verbose
plot

Save plots
...

Additional argumentos for DALEX::explain or ingredients::feature_importance

Examples


if(FALSE){

data("credit_woe")

m <- glm(bad ~ ., family = binomial, data = credit_woe)

m_featsel <- featsel_loss_function_permutations(m, stat = "min")

attr(m_featsel, "plots")

}
